pr_title: Don't omit body hash during async signing

timeline.bodyText: What if they've overridden the signer at the client level?
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Hmm I I have to take a closer look at this, I just copied it from an existing method :P
replies.author: dagnir

replies.bodyText:
Actually took a look at this again, the overrides, either at the client level or request level always take precedence. The async signer is treated as the "default" in the case where no overrides are provided at either level.
NM scratch that!
replies.author: dagnir

timeline.bodyText: Since this is an internal API, can we not do an overload with a branch in it? Maybe just change the existing callers to use the new method?
timeline.author: millems

timeline.bodyText:
This feels brittle. It feels like it'll be easy to update one branch of the code without updating the other.
Is there a way to unify the code paths? Maybe via adapting sync signers to async signers?
timeline.author: millems

timeline.bodyText: Why not CompletableFutureUtils.forwardExceptionTo here and below?
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Let me try it out. I was having a hard time to trying to reconcile the cancellation here and also ensuring that exceptions from the interceptor callbacks (e.g. afterTransmission) were propagated correctly back to the caller future and this is what I landed on.
replies.author: dagnir

timeline.author: millems

timeline.bodyText: This duplicates data that was already pulled out elsewhere. To prevent duplication, can we just pull out what we need here (similar to ENDPOINT_OVERRIDDEN.... SIGNER_OVERRIDDEN?)
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Sure; I added this change before I merged from master where ENDPOINT_OVERRIDDEN_OVERRIDE was! I'll copy the same pattern
replies.author: dagnir

timeline.message: Set flat when signer is overridden
Set flag when signer is overridden

Don't omit body hash during async signing

This fixes a bug where the SHA-256 of the request body is not included in the
SigV4 calculation for async, streaming (note: not event streaming) requests.
